item.title: Ultimate fat burning guide to help you achieve healthy weight loss fast: Nutritionist shares top 8 recommendations - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ultimate Fat Burning Guide to Help You Achieve Healthy Weight Loss Fast: Nutritionist Shares Top 8 Recommendations

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Nutritionist and lifestyle coach Raksha Lulla has shared a video outlining eight easy and sustainable habits for weight loss that can help individuals burn calories and achieve their health goals without feeling restricted.

  • 1. Eat till spaciousness: Stop when your stomach feels light and not heavy.
  • 2. Drink water from a glass: Stay hydrated without waiting to feel thirsty.
  • 3. Take magnesium glycinate: A nightly supplement that supports vitamin levels with a doctor's guidance.
  • 4. Add ghee to carbohydrates: Enhances fullness while moderating glycemic index.
  • 5. Walk for no reason: Engage in leisurely walking without specific goals.
  • 6. Add seasonal vegetables: Incorporate nutrient-rich vegetables for balanced nutrition.
  • 7. Strength train at least once a week: Focus on full-body exercises without explosive movements.
  • 8. Practice 4-7-8 breathing: Use this technique to center yourself each morning.
“This is the ultimate fat-burning guide that will make you the version of yourself – achieve a healthy weight loss and keep it off too!” - Raksha Lulla

This comprehensive guide emphasizes that weight loss should be sustainable and enjoyable, not a chore.

item.title: Can drinking coffee boost longevity? - Medical News Today
item.description:
Coffee May Help Prolong Lifespan by Almost 2 Years, on Average

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Medical News Today

A new review study suggests that regular coffee consumption may increase a person's lifespan by an average of 1.8 healthy years, reinforcing the beverage's positive health effects.

  • Coffee is one of the most popular beverages worldwide, with around 2 million cups consumed daily.
  • A recent review from the University of Coimbra highlights coffee's potential health benefits.
  • The study, funded by the Institute for Scientific Information on Coffee, analyzed over 50 studies on coffee consumption.

“Moderate intake of coffee was found to decrease the incidence of several chronic diseases.” – Rodrigo Cunha, PhD.

In conclusion, regular coffee consumption is associated with healthier aging; however, it is essential to consider individual health needs and consumption patterns.

item.title: Craving Sweets? Try Saumya Tandon's Healthy Sweet Potato Halwa Recipe For A Guilt-Free Indulgence - News18
item.description:
Craving Sweets? Try Saumya Tandon's Healthy Sweet Potato Halwa Recipe For A Guilt-Free Indulgence

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Saumya Tandon shared a healthy recipe for sweet potato halwa that eschews sugar and its substitutes, promoting guilt-free indulgence.

  • Saumya Tandon has been sugar-free for four years, including honey and jaggery.
  • She discusses her lifestyle changes and shares a sweet potato halwa recipe in her recent Instagram video.
  • The recipe includes healthy ingredients like ghee and milk, focusing on natural sweetness.
  • Users can prepare the dish easily with simple steps provided in the article.

“I gave up sugar/all sugar substitutes, honey and jaggery 4 years ago. I only eat fruits and dry fruits and desserts made of them. It’s a game changer. Try!”

In conclusion, Saumya Tandon's journey towards a sugar-free diet inspires many to explore healthier dessert options without compromising on taste.

item.title: Top 5 immunity-boosting drinks for winter - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Top 5 immunity-boosting drinks for winter

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

This article presents five delicious beverages aimed at enhancing immunity during the winter season, highlighting their health benefits and ingredients.

  • Turmeric Golden Milk: A warming blend of milk with turmeric, black pepper, and honey rich in antioxidants and anti-inflammatory properties.
  • Ginger Lemon Tea: A zesty mix of ginger, lemon, and honey offering a high dose of vitamin C, perfect for soothing sore throats.
  • Tulsi and Peppermint Tea: A calming infusion that combines tulsi and peppermint to boost immunity and alleviate nasal congestion.
  • Spiced Apple Cider: A festive drink made from simmered apple juice with cinnamon, cloves, and star anise, packed with antioxidants.
  • Amla and Ginger Juice: A refreshing juice made from fresh amla and ginger, rich in vitamin C, helping to strengthen immunity and detoxify the body.
"High in vitamin C, amla juice strengthens immunity and detoxifies the body." - Hindustan Times

In conclusion, integrating these immunity-boosting drinks into your winter routine can help maintain health and wellness during the colder months.

item.title: From Alia Bhatt to Deepika Padukone: 5 celebrity skincare routines you can follow - Health shots
item.description:
From Alia Bhatt to Deepika Padukone: 5 celebrity skincare routines you can follow

Published On: 15 Dec 2024, 10:30 am IST

Discover the secrets to radiant skin with these celebrity-inspired morning skincare routines. Know how to protect your skin like a star.

  • Alia Bhatt emphasizes gentle cleansing, toning, hydration, and sunscreen to achieve glowing skin.
  • Kriti Sanon starts her routine with ice water to reduce puffiness, followed by cleansing and hydrating products.
  • Deepika Padukone shares her moisturizing and sun protection techniques to maintain her skin’s health.
  • Madhuri Dixit uses mild cleansers and natural toners to refresh her skin and always applies sunscreen.
  • Kiara Advani follows a simple but effective regimen prioritizing gentle cleansing, hydration, and sun protection.
"These skincare routines contain simple ideas that everyone can follow in their everyday practice." - Article Summary

In conclusion, following the simple yet effective skincare routines of these celebrities can help achieve healthy, glowing skin. Remember, a blend of proper skincare, hydration, and sun protection is key.

item.title: The Essential Health Tests Every Woman Should Take During Menopause to Protect Bone Health - Zee News
item.description:
The Essential Health Tests Every Woman Should Take During Menopause to Protect Bone Health

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Zee News

Menopause is a critical phase for women that comes with health challenges, particularly affecting bone health. Regular screenings and specific tests are essential to understand and mitigate these risks.

  • Calcium and Vitamin D Levels: Essential for maintaining bone density; Vitamin D aids calcium absorption.
  • Bone Mineral Density (BMD) Test: Measures mineral density in bones to assess strength and fracture risk. Important for osteoporosis monitoring.
  • Hormone Level Testing: Evaluates estrogen and parathyroid hormone levels to understand bone health and osteoporosis risk.
  • Thyroid Function Tests: Monitors thyroid hormones that affect bone metabolism and density, especially in cases of hyperthyroidism.
"According to the National Osteoporosis Foundation, approximately 1 in 2 women over the age of 50 will experience a fracture due to osteoporosis."

In addition to these tests, it's crucial for women to assess lifestyle factors such as diet, exercise, and smoking that impact bone health. Regular check-ups can greatly assist in navigating menopause effectively.

item.title: Study Reveals Major Drawback to The Health Benefits of Fasting - ScienceAlert
item.description:
Study Reveals Major Drawback to The Health Benefits of Fasting

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: Science Alert

The article discusses a recent study revealing that fasting may not yield health benefits in shorter or intermittent fasts, emphasizing the need for more extended fasting periods to observe positive changes in the body.

  • The study indicates that more than three days of fasting is required for significant molecular changes in the body.
  • Health experts stress that fasting should be done under medical supervision, especially for certain demographics.
  • About a third of the proteins in the study participants showed significant systemic changes after a week of water-only fasting.
  • Fasting is linked to potential improvements in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and cardiovascular health after three days.
  • Research highlights the risks associated with prolonged fasting, including dehydration and starvation impacts.
"Our results provide evidence for the health benefits of fasting beyond weight loss, but these were only visible after three days of total caloric restriction – later than we previously thought." – Claudia Langenberg, Queen Mary University of London

The findings underscore the complexity of fasting's effects on health and suggest that more research is needed to safely harness its benefits without the risks associated with prolonged calorie deprivation.

item.title: Two more cases of bird flu in humans reported in California - The Guardian
item.description:
Two more cases of bird flu in humans reported in California

Publication Date: Friday

Source: Sacramento Bee

Two cases of bird flu have been reported in California’s San Joaquin county, affecting farmworkers exposed to infected animals.

  • Both individuals are recovering and exhibited mild symptoms.
  • There are a total of 34 confirmed cases of bird flu in California.
  • Health officials warn about the spread of bird flu in farm animals like poultry and cows.
  • Precautions recommended include using protective gear when working with potentially infected animals.
  • Total of 60 confirmed cases of bird flu across the United States.
"Bird flu is spreading in some farm animals like poultry and cows."

Symptoms include pink eye, fever, fatigue, cough, and respiratory issues, with treatments typically involving antiviral drugs.

item.title: Sold-out farm shops, smuggled deliveries and safety warnings: US battle over raw milk grows - The Guardian
item.description:
Sold-out farm shops, smuggled deliveries and safety warnings: US battle over raw milk grows

Publication Date: October 20, 2023 Source: The Guardian

The article discusses the increasing popularity of raw milk in the U.S., highlighting the cultural and political divides surrounding its production and distribution. With health advocates supporting raw milk alongside rising consumer demand, tensions related to safety and regulation continue to escalate.

  • Churchtown Dairy in New York sees weekly sellouts of their raw milk products.
  • Raw milk is linked to both health benefits and significant health risks, prompting government safety warnings.
  • The political landscape around raw milk encompasses both anti-government sentiments and health skepticism.
  • Sales of raw milk have surged between 21% and 65%, indicating strong consumer interest.
  • Amish communities and agricultural advocates are increasingly vocal in support of raw milk sales.
“Food production has always been political.” - Abby Rockefeller, owner of Churchtown Dairy.

Overall, while there is a push for more access to raw milk, public health officials urge caution, pointing to inherent risks associated with unpasteurized products. The conflict embodies broader societal debates about health, safety, and personal freedom.

item.title: Silent Killer In The Air: How Pollution Triples Your Blood Clot Risk - Times Now
item.description:
Silent Killer In The Air: How Pollution Triples Your Blood Clot Risk

Publication Date: December 12, 2023 | Source: Times Now

Prolonged exposure to polluted air can significantly increase the risk of developing dangerous blood clots, according to recent research conducted by the University of Minnesota.

  • The study followed over 6,600 participants across the U.S. for 17 years, analyzing their exposure to major air pollutants.
  • Chronic exposure to fine particulate matter increased the risk of blood clots by 43%.
  • Nitrogen dioxide exposure nearly tripled the odds of developing blood clots.
  • Nitrogen oxides were linked to a 2.3-fold increase in clot risk.
  • Ozone exposure showed no significant association with clot formation.
  • Blood clots can lead to life-threatening conditions, including deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolisms.
  • The study underscores the urgent need for stricter air quality regulations in the U.S.
“What’s striking from our study is the increase in serious blood clotting diseases with exposure to some of the most common types of pollutants in the air we breathe.” - Dr. Pamela Lutsey

In conclusion, the study highlights the serious health risks associated with air pollution and calls for action to improve air quality standards to protect public health.

item.title: 7 smart ways to use turmeric for weight loss - The Times of India
item.description:
7 smart ways to use turmeric for weight loss

Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: TimesOfIndia.com

Turmeric is known for its health benefits, particularly its potential role in weight loss. This article provides various methods for incorporating turmeric into your diet and lifestyle.

  • Turmeric's anti-inflammatory properties boost metabolism and improve digestion.
  • Drinking turmeric tea can enhance metabolism and aid digestion.
  • Infusing water with turmeric, ginger, and lemon serves as a detox drink.
  • Combining turmeric with black pepper and healthy fats increases curcumin absorption, aiding weight loss.
  • Turmeric supplements offer an easy option to receive concentrated doses.
  • Adding turmeric to meals may contribute to weight loss due to its thermogenic properties.
  • Golden milk, made with turmeric and milk, can help reduce inflammation.
“Turmeric's anti-inflammatory properties, boosts metabolism, improves digestion, regulates blood sugar, and aids weight loss making it a natural complement to your healthy lifestyle.”

Incorporating turmeric into your daily routine can support weight loss and enhance overall health. From drinks to meals, the versatility of turmeric makes it easy to add to your diet.
